channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: House and Senate send bill to release Epstein files to Trump's desk
item.description: A measure to compel the Justice Department to release its files on Jeffrey Epstein is on its way to President Trump's desk after quickly advancing through both chambers of Congress Tuesday.
item.content:encoded: A measure to compel the Justice Department to release its files on Jeffrey Epstein is on its way to President Trump's desk after quickly advancing through both chambers of Congress Tuesday.
item.dc:creator: Sam Gringlas

item.title: Sen. Maggie Hassan, D-N.H., on the vote to release the Epstein files
item.description: Democratic Sen. Maggie Hassan of New Hampshire reacts after both chambers of Congress moved to force the Justice Department to release its files on convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.
item.content:encoded: Democratic Sen. Maggie Hassan of New Hampshire reacts after both chambers of Congress moved to force the Justice Department to release its files on convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Judge rules Meta is not a monopoly, allowing it to keep WhatsApp and Instagram
item.description: A judge ruled Tuesday that Meta isn't a monopoly, a huge win for the tech giant. But analysts say it may spark fresh debate on how the government can regulate big tech.
item.content:encoded: A judge ruled Tuesday that Meta isn't a monopoly, a huge win for the tech giant. But analysts say it may spark fresh debate on how the government can regulate big tech.
item.dc:creator: John Ruwitch

item.title: Flu season could be nasty this winter
item.description: With a new flu virus variant circulating, scientists fear more sickness this winter. The vaccine may be slightly less effective, but doctors still urge getting one ASAP.
item.content:encoded:
With a new flu virus variant circulating, scientists fear more sickness this winter. The vaccine may be slightly less effective, but doctors still urge getting one ASAP.

(Image credit: Francine Orr)
item.dc:creator: Rob Stein

item.title: Poll: Democrats have biggest advantage for control of Congress in 8 years
item.description: A new NPR/PBS News/Marist poll shows some major warning signs for President Trump and Republicans ahead of the 2026 midterm elections as Americans want the president to focus on lowering prices.
item.content:encoded:
A new NPR/PBS News/Marist poll shows some major warning signs for President Trump and Republicans ahead of the 2026 midterm elections as Americans want the president to focus on lowering prices.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Domenico Montanaro

item.title: What we can learn about Kurt Cobain, Freddie Mercury and Beyoncé from their denim
item.description: An exhibition at Levi's San Francisco headquarters highlights how jeans can offer surprising insights into the lives and legacies of the artists who wore them.
item.content:encoded:
An exhibition at Levi's San Francisco headquarters highlights how jeans can offer surprising insights into the lives and legacies of the artists who wore them.

(Image credit: Loaned by Tom Coyne/David Fenton for Levi’s)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Trump defends Saudi crown prince over question about Khashoggi's death, measure to release Epstein files heads to Trump's desk, poll shows major warning signs for GOP ahead of the 2026 midterms.
item.content:encoded: Trump defends Saudi crown prince over question about Khashoggi's death, measure to release Epstein files heads to Trump's desk, poll shows major warning signs for GOP ahead of the 2026 midterms.
item.dc:creator: A Martínez

item.title: New policies make U.S. less appealing to foreign-born physicians
item.description: Immigrants make up about a quarter of all the country's doctors. New policies are making it harder and less appealing for foreign-born physicians to come to the U.S.
item.content:encoded: Immigrants make up about a quarter of all the country's doctors. New policies are making it harder and less appealing for foreign-born physicians to come to the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Yuki Noguchi

item.title: Antisemitism task force regroups after severing ties with the Heritage Foundation
item.description: After cutting ties with the Heritage Foundation, an antisemitism task force formed to address what they described as left-wing antisemitism has reformed independently and broadened its focus.
item.content:encoded: After cutting ties with the Heritage Foundation, an antisemitism task force formed to address what they described as left-wing antisemitism has reformed independently and broadened its focus.
item.dc:creator: Sarah McCammon

item.title: With new U.S. threat looming, how will Venezuela's leader keep his grip on power?
item.description: Venezuela's President Nicolás Maduro has survived U.S. sanctions, economic meltdown and widespread protests. Now he faces a U.S. armada off his country's coast, so how does he hang on to power?
item.content:encoded: Venezuela's President Nicolás Maduro has survived U.S. sanctions, economic meltdown and widespread protests. Now he faces a U.S. armada off his country's coast, so how does he hang on to power?
item.dc:creator: John Otis
